Column Comment.0: WORK ORDER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the work order.
Column Comment.1: INSTRUCTION IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for an instruction associated wth awork order.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: BA ADDRESS OBSERVATION NUMBER: observation number for the ba address,used as part of the foreign key relationship.
Column Comment.4: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ADDRESS SOURCE: The source of the BA addressinformation.
Column Comment.5: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique observation number forthe business associate with repsect to involvement in a work order.
Column Comment.6: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the business associatewho is involved with this work order as a client, service provider, intermediary etc.The BA may be a company, contact name etc.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.9: INSTRUCTION DESCRIPTION: Text description of the instructions.
Column Comment.10: WORK ORDER INSTRUCTION: A list of coded values for specific instructionsassociated with work orders. May be used in conjunction with description fields asappropriate.
Column Comment.11: INSTRUCTION VALUE: Allows the instruction to carry a numeric value such as acount or a size.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
